Comments_List: I learnt a lot of rigorous mathematics that I always wished to learn, under a professor that was always helpful in explaining the course material.
Concepts and theorems in functional analysis, mathematical thinking and reasoning.

We covered many interesting things, like the general theory of Hilbert/Banach spaces, Baire category theorem, open mapping theorem, spectral theory, the weak topology, and Fredholm theory. It would have been nice to see some applications outside of differential equations (although the ODEs application was very cool, I didn't really understand the PDEs application).
Strngth: As a statistics PhD student it improved my understanding of function spaces that I think will really be helpful for my research.
Strength: clear lecture and helpful office hour. Weakness: make the optional practice problem set mandatory!
I would definitely recommend this course to any student who is interested in carefully done mathematics since it is very intellectually challenging and stimulating.
Functional analysis was definitely a good class, I learned a lot. Manas is generally a clear lecturer, motivates stuff well. I liked the homework.
Yes. This is a hard class, but it's fun.
